title: Bug 3970[preferences] UI needed to define the default line delimiters for new files (1GFIOAX)
description: Bug 3970[preferences] UI needed to define the default line delimiters for new files (1GFIOAX) the Windows work stations are used as X terminals and to run Eclipse (since PC are cheaper than Unix boxes).
OB: When a new file is created on Windows using Eclipse, the line delimiters are automatically set to the Windows format (CR-LF).
EB: Even if the new file is created on Windows, it should have Unix line delimiters (LF) since the end product is a Unix product.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Launch Eclipse on a Windows workstation.
2. Create a new file.
3. Check the line delimiters used in the new file.

Expected behavior:
- The new file should have Unix line delimiters (LF) by default.

Notes:
- There should be a UI (Preference) available in the Workbench to define the line delimiter for new files.
- Possible values for line delimiters should include: Dos/Windows, Mac, Unix, and the default platform line delimiter.
- The UI should be provided by the Workbench to ensure all plugins use the same line delimiter for new files.
